title: mRNA vaccines take the sting out of malaria infection—and transmission
author: Helen Floersh
description: After nearly four decades of development, the world finally has a malaria vaccine. The first large-scale rollout of GlaxoSmithKline's RTS,S, or Mosquirix, kicked off at the end of November. | A research team used mRNA to build a two-part vaccine set that both prevents infection and stops the cycle of malaria transmission between people and mosquitoes.
